simple.xml.load
Interface Persistable

public interface Persistable

The Persistable interface is used to receive callbacks from the deserialization of an object. This is an optional interface that an object can implement if it wants to perform any validation or post processing of deserialization.

The callbacks received by an object implementing this interface are validate followed by commit. These callbacks give the object an opportunity to validate the values that have been deserialized before the object performs actions to build further data structures with the deserialized fields.

Author:
Niall Gallagher
See Also:
Persister

Method Summary
 void commit()
          The commit method is invoked if validation passes and no exception is thrown from the validate method.
 void validate()
          The validate method is invoked immediately after the object has been deserialized.
 

Method Detail

validate

void validate()
              throws java.lang.Exception
The validate method is invoked immediately after the object has been deserialized. This is used to validate the data that has been read from the XML document. If any values do not pass validation this can throw an exception, stopping the process of deserialization.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the deserialized values are invalid

commit

void commit()
            throws java.lang.Exception
The commit method is invoked if validation passes and no exception is thrown from the validate method. This is used for post processing, it allows the object to build further data structures when the annotated fields have been read from the XML document. If the post processing cannot be performed this can thrown an exception to stop deserialization.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if post processing caused an error
